cake is a lie, just like portal 3

This game is absolutely fantastic. Played it on the xbox one a year ago and decided I should play it on the pc, was still the same good old portal. Its a very simple game, make portals, solve puzzles and thats it. I love these story mode puzzle games their really fun and it activates the brain for once. Portal is like school but in a game but the only subject is science and the class is learning about portals and traveling through them. I love the story and the characters, Wheatley was hilarous and GLados was once again amazing. Loved the puzzles they are simple and easy to learn so if you want to speedrun this game do it. 5 stars got nothing else to say.
Amazing game with amazing mechanics and amazing story.

Great graphics but not very demanding, good story and very stimulating puzzles.

This game is awesome. The puzzles were the perfect difficulty where you had to think but you never felt stuck for very long. Plus the game is constantly changing up and adding new things to mess with causing the game to never feel stale. It perfectly teaches you to play and understand whats going on with no tips/tutorial. Also, the voice acting is so good. Maybe I just like Wheatley's(Stephan Merchants) voice. I got it for 2 dollars(which I think is basically robbery) but I wouldve paid upwards of 20 bucks for it.
just like teleport not that hard

Ich habe den Koop-Modus mit einem Freund in 6 Stunden durchgespielt und es war echt nice. 
Es hat uns sehr viel Spa√ü gemacht.

I liked the single player. The coop I played with my SO, who has hyper-sensitivity to criticism, couldn't play past the first few puzzles because of how mean Glados is. I suppose the game is not for the thin skinned.

This game is amazing. Everything from the first game is expanded upon, done better or both. Every character you meet, (or listen to, I guess) is full of character and hilarious, even though they either don't have an actual face, or you never see it. I don't think they could have found a better voice for... the guy who funded and owned aperture science, I forgot his name, I don't know why. GlaDOS is one of the most hilarious characters in a video game, period. Her monotone delivery and deadpan lines is hysterical, nearly every line that comes out of her... metal audio thing? Anyways, it's just perfect. Wheatly on paper sounds like he'd get annoying and grating quickly, but he stays just as funny the entire time, probably even funnier as the campaign continues. Does the twist that happen a while through the game shock me? No. Was it well executed and still a bit surprising? Yes. The visual style is phenomenal, the overgrown vines and moss contrasting with the white and gray modern testing labs looks amazing. This is super well optimized, since there usually any entities that need to be spawned. The music is even better than in the last game, with some parts having high-tempo electronic beats and others having swelling orchestral ambiance. This game is amazing, highly recommend.

Great game, better than the first. Haven't even played the co-op yet, but like the base game was already amazing and had brilliant, brilliant writing. Wheatley funny

Portal 2 is a great game that still lives up to many standards of games today. Looks nice, has nice puzzles, funny jokes, some interesting backstory revealed

A great puzzle game with a nice story that I'm happy to say lives up to its reputation. While there are community made puzzles a such, its nice to just play a game thats designed to give a high quality, well designed and "short" (by present day tripple A standards) game that isnt stretched out longer than it should be, and does as much as it can with its core concept.
it's story and stuff is gud

Very well made sequel to the franchise. Loveable characters, chambers that are fairly easy (but some are more challenging), I would highly recommend this game to anyone who played the first Portal. Multiplayer is also a nice touch

More than worthy successor to the first Portal.
